alert.note: Alert for Conway; Northwest Yell County; Perry; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Logan, south central Johnson, northwestern Perry, southwestern Conway, central Yell and southwestern Pope Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Midway in Logan County to 6 miles south of Plainview in Yell County. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Russellville... Danville... Dardanelle... Pottsville... Dover... Ola... London... Lake Dardanelle State Park... Carden Bottoms... Mt Nebo State Park... Plainview in Yell County... Lake Dardanelle... Petit Jean River WMA... Galla Creek WMA... Mosley... Taral... Belleville... Casa... Aplin... Corinth... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 68 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
